intro: Racosperma moirii subsp. recurvistipulum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant features slender, often recurved leaflets and produces yellow flowers in clusters. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant traits. Its subspecies status highlights subtle morphological differences from the nominate species.
